com.arjuna.mw.wstx
Interface UserTransaction

public interface UserTransaction

The user portion of the transaction API.

Since:
1.0.
Version:
$Id: UserTransaction.java,v 1.1 2002/11/25 11:00:51 nmcl Exp $
Author:
Mark Little (mark.little@arjuna.com)

          Start a new transaction.

Method Detail

begin

public void begin()
           throws WrongStateException,
                  SystemException
Start a new transaction. If there is already a transaction associated with the thread then it will be nested.
Throws:
WrongStateException - Thrown if the any currently associated transaction is in a state that does not allow a new transaction to be enlisted.
SystemException - Thrown in any other situation.

commit

public void commit()
            throws InvalidTransactionException,
                   WrongStateException,
                   HeuristicHazardException,
                   HeuristicMixedException,
                   SystemException,
                   NoTransactionException,
                   TransactionRolledBackException
Commit the transaction. All participants that are still enlisted with the transaction are committed.
Throws:
InvalidTransactionException - Thrown if the current transaction is not known about by the transaction system.
WrongStateException - Thrown if the current transaction is not in a state that allows commit to be called.
HeuristicHazardException - Thrown if the participants generated a hazard heuristic.
HeuristicMixedException - Thrown if the participants generated a mixed heuristic.
NoTransactionException - Thrown if there is no transaction associated with the invoking thread.
SystemException - Thrown if some other error occurred.

rollback

public void rollback()
              throws InvalidTransactionException,
                     WrongStateException,
                     HeuristicHazardException,
                     HeuristicMixedException,
                     SystemException,
                     NoTransactionException,
                     TransactionCommittedException
Abort the transaction. All participants that are still enlisted with the transaction are rolled back.
Throws:
InvalidTransactionException - Thrown if the current transaction is not known about by the transaction system.
WrongStateException - Thrown if the current transaction is not in a state that allows cancel to be called.
HeuristicHazardException - Thrown if the participants generated a hazard heuristic.
HeuristicMixedException - Thrown if the participants generated a mixed heuristic.
NoTransactionException - Thrown if there is no transaction associated with the invoking thread.
SystemException - Thrown if some other error occurred.

status

public Status status()
              throws SystemException
Returns:
the status of the current transaction. If there is no transaction associated with the thread then NO_TRANSACTION will be returned.
Throws:
SystemException - Thrown if any error occurs.

transactionName

public java.lang.String transactionName()
                                 throws NoTransactionException,
                                        SystemException
What is the name of the current transaction? Use only for debugging purposes.
Returns:
the name of the transaction.
Throws:
NoTransactionException - Thrown if there is no transaction associated with the invoking thread.
SystemException - Thrown if any other error occurs.

suspend

public TransactionHierarchy suspend()
                             throws SystemException
Suspend all transactions associated with this thread. The thread then becomes associated with no transaction.
Returns:
a representation of the context associated with the thread, or null if there is no context.
Throws:
SystemException - if any error occurs.

resume

public void resume(TransactionHierarchy tx)
            throws InvalidTransactionException,
                   SystemException
Associate this thread with the specified context. Any current associations are lost.
Parameters:
TxContext - tx The context representation to associate (may be null).
Throws:
InvalidTransactionException - Thrown if the context is invalid.
SystemException - Thrown if any other error occurs.

currentTransaction

public TransactionHierarchy currentTransaction()
                                        throws SystemException
Returns:
a representation of the context currently associated with the invoking thread, or null if there is none.

qualifiers

public Qualifier[] qualifiers()
                       throws NoTransactionException,
                              SystemException
Returns:
the qualifiers that are currently associated with the transaction, or null if there are none.
Throws:
NoTransactionException - Thrown if there is no transaction associated with the current thread.
SystemException - Thrown if any other error occurs.

setRollbackOnly

public void setRollbackOnly()
                     throws NoTransactionException,
                            WrongStateException,
                            SystemException
Set the state of the transaction such that the only possible outcome is for it to rollback.
Throws:
NoTransactionException - Thrown if there is no transaction associated with the current thread.
WrongStateException - Thrown if the state of the transaction is such that it is not possible to put it into a rollback-only state, e.g., it is committing.
SystemException - Thrown if any other error occurs.

getTimeout

public int getTimeout()
               throws SystemException
Get the timeout value currently associated with the transaction.
Returns:
the timeout value in seconds, or 0 if no application specified timeout has been provided.
Throws:
SystemException - Thrown if any error occurs.

setTimeout

public void setTimeout(int timeout)
                throws InvalidTimeoutException,
                       SystemException
Set the timeout to be associated with all subsequently created transactions. A default value of 0 is automatically associated with each thread and this means that no application specified timeout is set for activities.
Parameters:
int - timeout The timeout (in seconds) to associate with all subsequently created activities. This value must be 0 or greater.
Throws:
InvalidTimeoutException - Thrown if the timeout value provided is negative, too large, or if timeouts are simply not supported by the activity implementation.
SystemException - Thrown if any other error occurs.

identifier

public TxId identifier()
                throws NoTransactionException,
                       SystemException
Returns:
the unique transaction id for the current transaction. This may or may not be the same as the activity id.
Throws:
NoTransactionException - Thrown if there is no activity associated with the invoking thread.
SystemException - Thrown if some other error occurred.
